title: The Day of the LORD
shortSummary: Joel chapter 2 vividly describes the coming 'Day of the LORD,' a time of divine judgment and restoration. It calls God's people to repentance and promises future blessings, including the outpouring of the Spirit and deliverance for those who call on the Lord.
timeline: c. 9th to 8th century BC - Prophetic ministry of Joel in Judah

keyCharacters.name: Joel
keyCharacters.description: The prophet who delivers God's message of warning, repentance, and hope to the people of Judah.

keyCharacters.name: The LORD
keyCharacters.description: God who speaks directly in this chapter, declaring judgment and offering mercy and restoration.

keyCharacters.name: The Priests
keyCharacters.description: Ministers of the LORD called to lead the people in intercession and mourning (Joel 2:17).

keyCharacters.name: The People of Judah
keyCharacters.description: The inhabitants called to repent and turn to God in fasting and prayer to avoid judgment and receive blessing.

definitions.definition: A future time of God's decisive intervention in history involving judgment on the wicked and salvation for His people.

definitions.term: Rend your heart, and not your garments
definitions.definition: A call to genuine inner repentance rather than mere outward religious display.
Agricultural terms referring to early and late seasonal rains essential for crop growth, symbolizing God's provision and blessing.
To set apart a day for fasting and solemn assembly as an act of repentance and seeking God's mercy.

outline.heading: The Coming Day of the LORD and Its Terror
outline.description: Joel sounds a trumpet alarm warning of an unprecedented and terrifying invasion symbolizing the Day of the LORD. The imagery emphasizes God's power and the inevitability of His judgment.

outline.heading: Call to Repentance
outline.description: God calls His people to heartfelt repentance with fasting, weeping, and prayer, urging them to seek Him sincerely rather than relying on outward rituals.

outline.heading: God’s Promise of Restoration
outline.description: In response to repentance, God promises to restore the land, provide abundant blessings, and remove the invading enemy, demonstrating His mercy and faithfulness.

outline.heading: The Outpouring of the Spirit and Signs of the Day
outline.description: God foretells the future outpouring of His Spirit on all people, accompanied by cosmic signs, culminating in salvation for all who call on the LORD, highlighting the hope beyond judgment.

application: Respond to God’s call to genuine repentance by examining your heart and turning fully to Him with sincerity.
Engage regularly in prayer and fasting as spiritual disciplines to seek God’s mercy and guidance in times of trouble.
Trust in God’s promises of restoration and provision, remembering that He is gracious and merciful to those who obey Him.
Be encouraged by the promise of the Holy Spirit’s outpouring, empowering believers to live boldly for God and proclaim His truth.

keyVerses.text: Therefore also now, saith the LORD, turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning:
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the necessity of sincere, whole-hearted repentance as the proper response to God’s warning.

keyVerses.text: And rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the LORD your God: for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth him of the evil.
keyVerses.significance: It teaches that God desires true inner repentance over external show and reminds us of His gracious character.

keyVerses.text: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions:
keyVerses.significance: This prophecy foretells the inclusive outpouring of the Holy Spirit, foundational for New Testament fulfillment and Christian empowerment.

keyVerses.text: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the LORD shall be delivered: for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem shall be deliverance, as the LORD hath said, and in the remnant whom the LORD shall call.
keyVerses.significance: This verse assures salvation to all who call on the Lord, emphasizing God’s mercy and the hope of deliverance.
